00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantIterPlier.cpp
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Mon Oct 24 11:48:48 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Class for doing probe set quantification estimate by iteratively
00028  * calling PLIER with the probes that best correlate with signal estimate.
00029  */
00030 
00031 //
00032 #include "chipstream/QuantIterPlier.h"
00033 //
00034 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00035 
00036 /** 
00037  * Constructor.  
00038  */
00039 QuantIterPlier::QuantIterPlier(QuantPlierParams &plierParams)
00040   : QuantPlierBase(plierParams) {
00041   initMemory();
00042   setupSelfDoc(*this);
00043   m_Type = getDocName();
00044   // this is bogus -- we dont know how much we need!
00045   // Initialize memory buffers.
00046   // allocMemory(100, 50);
00047   setUsePrecompFeatureEffects(false);
00048 }
00049 
00050 /**
00051  * Destructor.
00052  */
00053 QuantIterPlier::~QuantIterPlier() {
00054   freeMemory();
00055 }
00056 
00057 void QuantIterPlier::initMemory() {
00058   m_MaxChips=0;
00059   m_MaxProbes=0;
00060 
00061   m_MM=NULL;
00062   m_PM=NULL;
00063   m_Residuals=NULL;
00064 
00065   m_ChipEffects=NULL;
00066   m_ProbeEffects=NULL;
00067   m_ProbesUsed=NULL;
00068 }
00069 
00070 /** 
00071  * @brief Free up all the memory that has bee allocated.
00072  */
00073 void QuantIterPlier::freeMemory() {
00074   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_MaxChips; i++) {
00075     delete [] m_PM[i];
00076     delete [] m_MM[i];
00077     delete [] m_Residuals[i];
00078   }
00079   delete [] m_MM;
00080   delete [] m_PM;
00081   delete [] m_Residuals;
00082   m_MaxChips=0;
00083   m_MaxProbes=0;
00084   //
00085   delete [] m_ChipEffects;
00086   delete [] m_ProbeEffects;
00087   delete [] m_ProbesUsed;
00088 }
00089 
00090 /** 
00091  * @brief Allocate enough memory for at least maxChips and
00092  * maxProbes.
00093  * 
00094  * @param maxChips - Number of chips that can be computed.
00095  * @param maxProbes - Number of probes or features that can be computed.
00096  */
00097 void QuantIterPlier::allocMemory(unsigned int maxChips, unsigned int maxProbes) {
00098   // fre what we have.
00099   freeMemory();
00100 
00101   m_MaxChips = maxChips;
00102   m_MaxProbes = maxProbes;
00103 
00104   m_ProbeEffects = new double[m_MaxProbes];
00105   m_ProbesUsed = new  int[m_MaxProbes];
00106   m_ChipEffects = new double[m_MaxChips];
00107 
00108   m_PM = new double *[m_MaxChips];
00109   m_MM = new double *[m_MaxChips];
00110   m_Residuals = new double *[m_MaxChips];
00111   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_MaxChips; i++) {
00112     m_PM[i] = new double[m_MaxProbes];
00113     m_MM[i] = new double[m_MaxProbes];
00114     m_Residuals[i] = new double[m_MaxProbes];
00115   }
00116 }
00117 
00118 /** 
00119  * @brief Do the heavy lifting of plier.
00120  */
00121 void QuantIterPlier::computeEstimate() {
00122   long errorCode = 0;
00123   unsigned int i = 0;
00124   int *moreIterations = (int *)malloc(m_Iterations.size()*sizeof(int));
00125 
00126   m_IterPlier.memEnsureSize(m_ChipCount,m_ProbeCount);
00127 
00128   for (i = 0; i < m_Iterations.size(); i++) {
00129     moreIterations[i] = m_Iterations[i];
00130   }
00131   errorCode = m_IterPlier.runCorrIterPlier(m_Plier, m_ProbeCount, m_ChipCount,
00132                                            m_PM, m_MM, m_ChipEffects, m_ProbeEffects,
00133                                            m_Residuals, m_ProbesUsed, m_Iterations.size(), 
00134                                            moreIterations);
00135   free((void *)moreIterations);
00136   if(errorCode != 0) 
00137     Err::errAbort("Problem running plier. Error code: " + ToStr(errorCode));
00138 }
